title: using the onnx model with opencv
body:
hi  ;)
i'm trying to use the [lightweight-human-pose model](https://github.com/opencv/opencv_extra/blob/master/testdata/dnn/download_models.py#L783-L787) [on colab](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/186N1ZF5UrCCD2lKMWjQYAAK35DV9Geje#scrollTo=vxUNWtml8hNW):

```
!wget 'https://drive.google.com/uc?export=dowload&id=1T2Kq01WXzPMrQdnEOUEiVBhwouW8Pka5' -O pose.onnx

net = cv2.dnn.readNet("pose.onnx")
# load 256x256 image and sent through net
net.dumpToFile("pose_dot.txt")
!dot pose_dot.txt -Tpng -opose_dot.png
```
and the last layer :
![Clipboard01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/854416/70997603-c4cb4480-20d5-11ea-9a8a-7b987387fe3c.jpg)

that looks weird. 38 heatmaps ? shouldn't it have 19 heat and 2x19 paf maps (=57) ?
or, if it's meant to be used for single persons , 19 heatmaps only ?

i look at the model: 
https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/blob/55093417d383c25a0f2454eba352198c944290d1/models/with_mobilenet.py#L90

and it should have returned [heatmaps, pafs] here:
https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/blob/55093417d383c25a0f2454eba352198c944290d1/models/with_mobilenet.py#L86

but it looks to me, like we only have the pafs returned from the forward pass in opencv


the [newly added opencv Keypoints model](https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/15189/files#diff-6de938636906f03a3c475c556f5c8878R166) tries to loop over all of them, and results look quite bad ;(
